definitions.definition: A joint or the collection of joints at which something is articulated , or hinged, for bending.
examples: The articulation allowed the robot to move around corners.

subdefinitions.definition: Such a joint in an animalian body, as for example between bones or between exoskeleton segments.

definitions.definition: A manner or method by which elements of a system are connected.
The quality, clarity , or sharpness of speech ; the movement within the mouth that allows for those things.
examples: His volume is reasonable, but his articulation could use work.

definitions.definition: The mechanism by which a sound is formed in the vocal tract .
The manner in which a note is attacked .
examples: The articulation in this piece is tricky because it alternates between legato and staccato.

definitions.definition: The interrelation and congruence of the flow of data between financial statements of an entity, especially between the income statement and balance sheet .
The induction of a pupil into a new school or college .

main_definition: ( countable or uncountable ) A joint or the collection of joints at which something is articulated , or hinged, for bending.
secondary_definitions: ( countable ) A manner or method by which elements of a system are connected.
( uncountable ) The quality, clarity , or sharpness of speech ; the movement within the mouth that allows for those things.
( phonetics ) The mechanism by which a sound is formed in the vocal tract .
( music , uncountable ) The manner in which a note is attacked .
( accounting ) The interrelation and congruence of the flow of data between financial statements of an entity, especially between the income statement and balance sheet .
( education ) The induction of a pupil into a new school or college .
